intro: Racosperma storyi, commonly known as the River Red Gum, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and distinctive flaky bark. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or brown in color. It thrives in riverine environments and is well-adapted to seasonal flooding. Racosperma storyi plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining soil stability.
